item.title: Marc A. add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Labor is prior to, and independent of, capital. Capital is only the fruit of labor, and could never have existed if labor had not first existed. Labor is the superior of capital, and deserves much the higher consideration." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Marc A. add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "The literal mind can never understand the ironic mind." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Marc A. add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Reason is not automatic. Those who deny it cannot be conquered by it. Do not count on them. Leave them alone." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Marc A. add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "I would hurl words into this darkness and wait for an echo, and if an echo sounded, no matter how faintly, I would send other words to tell, to march, to fight, to create a sense of the hunger for life that gnaws in us all." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Marc A. add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Do I contradict myself? Very well, then, I contradict myself; I am large -- I contain multitudes." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Marc A. add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "I know that most men, including those at ease with problems of the greatest complexity, can seldom accept even the simplest and most obvious truth if it be such as would oblige them to admit the falsity of conclusions which they have delighted in explaining to colleagues, which they have proudly taught to others, and which they have woven, thread by thread, into the fabric of their lives." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Marc A. add a quote by Thomas Paine
item.description: "Arguing with one who will not accept facts is like administering medicine to the dead." -- Thomas Paine

item.title: Marc A. add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Marc A. add a quote by Edmund Burke
item.description: "Never apologise for showing feeling. When you do so, you apologise for the truth." -- Edmund Burke

item.title: Marc A. add a quote by Edmund Burke
item.description: "Nobody made a greater mistake than he who did nothing because he could do only a little." -- Edmund Burke

item.title: Marc A. add a quote by Dwight D. Eisenhower
item.description: "Should any political party attempt to abolish social security unemployment insurance and eliminate labor laws and farm programs you would not hear of that party again in our political history. There is a tiny splinter group of course that believes you can do these things. Among them are a few other Texas oil millionaires and an occasional politician or business man from other areas. Their number is negligible and they are stupid." -- Dwight D. Eisenhower

item.title: Marc A. add a quote by Margaret Drabble
item.description: "Perhaps the rare and simple pleasure of being seen for what one is compensates for the misery of being it." -- Margaret Drabble
